brief_summary.textblock: A multe-center, non-interventional study in Europe to evaluate Pliaglis in dialy practice

clinical_study.brief_title: A Non-interventional Study to Evaluate the Use of Pliaglis in Daily Practice

detailed_description.textblock:
A multi-center, non-interventional study, including up to 700 subjects at approximately 70
      sites in 5 European countries to evaluate the post-market safety profile of Pliaglis and the
      efficacy of Pliaglis in terms of pain reduction, satisfaction with the product and daily
      practice use prior to pre-defined aesthetic procedures.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Signed informed consent

          -  Patient treated with Pliaglis by the Investigator or other healthcare professional
             according to label (refer to SmPC)

          -  Patient had already consented to receive any one or more of the following aesthetic
             procedures after Pliaglis administration:

               1. Pulsed-dye laser therapy

               2. Laser-assisted hair removal

               3. Non-ablative laser resurfacing

               4. Dermal filler injection

               5. Vascular access

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patient treated with other injectable or topical anaesthetic(s) for the pre-defined
             aesthetic procedure

          -  Previous participation in this study

study_pop.textblock:
Patient aiming to perform one or more of the following aesthetic procedures:

          1. Pulsed-dye laser therapy

          2. Laser-assisted hair removal

          3. Non-ablative laser resurfacing

          4. Dermal filler injection

          5. Vascular access

clinical_study.official_title: A Non-interventional Study to Evaluate the Use of Pliaglis in Daily Practice

primary_outcome.measure: Post-market safety profile of Pliaglis assessed on spontaneously reported Adverse Reactions
primary_outcome.time_frame: After Pliaglis application and throughout the site visit (day of application)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Pain intensity by VAS, satisfaction with pain reduction, willingness to re-use/recommend Pliaglis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After completing Pliaglis treatment and procedure, i.e. at the end of the site visit (day of application)
